entry.title: The Navier-Stokes equations in vector calculus notation, Einstein notation, and Cartesian components

link.title: The Navier-Stokes equations in vector calculus notation, Einstein notation, and Cartesian components

entry.content:
Introduction

In this post, I will give several important equations in fluid mechanics in three forms: vector calculus notation, Einstein notation, and with the Cartesian components written out. The purpose of this post is for education. I find is much easier to understand different forms and notations of the equations when they are written side-by-side, and derived sequentially. In particular, seeing the Einstein/index/tensor notation and Cartesian components side-by-side is helpful in learning Einstein notation.

References I used to compile this post:

  1. Çengel and Cimbala, Fluid Mechanics: Fundamentals and Applications, McGraw Hill, 4th Edition.
  2. Pope, Turbulent Flows, Cambridge University Press.
  3. Wikipedia Page on Navier-Stokes Equations

Prerequisites

Tensors

| | Vector calculus notation | Einstein notation | Cartesian components | |—————–|:————————:|:—————–:|:—————————————————————————————————————-:| | Vector | \(\vec{a}\) | \(a_i\) | \( egin{bmatrix} a_x\ a_y\ a_z \end{bmatrix}\) | | Velocity vector | \(\vec{V}\) | \(v_i\) | \( egin{bmatrix} u\ v\ w \end{bmatrix}\) | | Matrix | \(A\) | \(A_{ij}\) | \( egin{bmatrix} A_{xx} & A_{xy} & A_{xz}\ A_{yx} & A_{yy} & A_{yz}\ A_{zx} & A_{zy} & A_{zz} \end{bmatrix}\) | | Identity matrix | \(I\) | \(\delta_{ij}\) | \( egin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0\ 0 & 1 & 0\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}\)

Operations

| | Vector calculus notation | Einstein notation | Cartesian components | |———————————|:————————————————:|:—————————————-:|:—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————-:| | Dot product or inner product | \(\vec{a}\cdot \vec{b}\) | \(a_i b_i\) | \(a_x b_x + a_y b_y + a_z b_z\) | | Divergence of a vector | \(\vec{ abla}\cdot \vec{a}\) | \( rac{\partial a_i}{\partial x_i}\) | \( rac{\partial a_x}{\partial x} + rac{\partial a_y}{\partial y} + rac{\partial a_z}{\partial z}\) | | Vector - matrix product | \(\vec{a}\cdot B\) | \(a_i B_{ij}\) | \( egin{bmatrix} a_x B_{xx} & a_yB_{xy} & a_zB_{xz}\ a_x B_{yx} & a_yB_{yy} & a_zB_{yz}\ a_x B_{zx} & a_yB_{zy} & a_zB_{zz} \end{bmatrix}\) | | Divergence of a tensor | \(\vec{ abla}\cdot A\) | \( rac{\partial A_{ji}}{\partial x_j}\) | \( egin{bmatrix} rac{\partial B_{xx}}{\partial x} + rac{\partial B_{yx}}{\partial y} + rac{\partial B_{zx}}{\partial z}\ rac{\partial B_{xy}}{\partial x} + rac{\partial B_{yy}}{\partial y} + rac{\partial B_{zy}}{\partial z}\ rac{\partial B_{xz}}{\partial x} + rac{\partial B_{yz}}{\partial y} + rac{\partial B_{zz}}{\partial z} \end{bmatrix}\) | | Tensor product or outer product | \(\vec{a}\vec{b}\) or \(\vec{a}\otimes \vec{b}\) | \(a_i b_j\) | \( egin{bmatrix} a_x b_x & a_x b_y & a_x b_z \ a_y b_x & a_y b_y & a_y b_z \ a_z b_x & a_z b_y & a_z b_z \end{bmatrix}\) | | Gradient of a vector | \(\vec{ abla} \vec{a}\) | \( rac{\partial a_i}{\partial x_j}\) | \( egin{bmatrix} rac{\partial a_x}{\partial x} & rac{\partial a_x}{\partial y} & rac{\partial a_x}{\partial z} \ rac{\partial a_y}{\partial x} & rac{\partial a_y}{\partial y} & rac{\partial a_y}{\partial z}\ rac{\partial a_z}{\partial x} & rac{\partial a_z}{\partial y} & rac{\partial a_z}{\partial z} \end{bmatrix}\) |

Equations in fluid mechanics

Equations are given in bold, and definitions of various quantities are given in italics. We start with Cauchy’s equation, then expand the various terms to arrive at the compressible Navier-Stokes equations. After assuming constant density, we arrive at the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations.

  Vector calculus notation Einstein notation Cartesian components
Compressible continuity equation \( rac{\partial ho}{\partial t} + \vec{ abla} \cdot ( ho \vec{V}) = 0\) \( rac{\partial ho}{\partial t} + rac{\partial ( ho v_j)}{\partial x_j} = 0\) \( rac{\partial ho}{\partial t} + rac{\partial( ho u)}{\partial x} + rac{\partial ( ho v)}{\partial y} + rac{\partial ( ho w)}{\partial z} = 0\)
Incompressible continuity equation (\( ho\) = constant) \(\vec{ abla} \cdot \vec{V} = 0\) \( rac{\partial v_j}{\partial x_j} = 0\) \( rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + rac{\partial w}{\partial z} = 0\)
Cauchy’s equation \( rac{\partial ( ho \vec{V})}{\partial t} + \vec{ abla} \cdot ( ho \vec{V} \vec{V}) = ho \vec{g} + \vec{ abla} \cdot \sigma\) \( rac{\partial ( ho v_j)}{\partial t} + rac{\partial }{\partial x_i}( ho v_j v_i) = ho g_j + rac{\partial \sigma_{ij}}{\partial x_i}\) \( egin{align*} rac{\partial( ho u)}{\partial t} + rac{\partial( ho uu)}{\partial x} + rac{\partial ( ho uv)}{\partial y} + rac{\partial ( ho uw)}{\partial z} &= ho g_x + rac{\partial \sigma_{xx}}{\partial x} + rac{\sigma_{yx}}{\partial y} + rac{\sigma_{zx}}{\partial z}\ rac{\partial ( ho v)}{\partial t } + rac{\partial ( ho u v)}{\partial x } + rac{\partial ( ho v v)}{\partial y} + rac{\partial ( ho v w)}{\partial z}&= ho g_y + rac{\partial \sigma_{xy}}{\partial x} + rac{\sigma_{yy}}{\partial y} + rac{\sigma_{zy}}{\partial z}\ rac{\partial ( ho w)}{\partial t} + rac{\partial ( ho u w)}{\partial x} + rac{\partial( ho v w)}{\partial y} + rac{\partial ( ho w w)}{\partial z}&= ho g_z + rac{\partial \sigma_{xz}}{\partial x} + rac{\sigma_{yz}}{\partial y} + rac{\sigma_{zz}}{\partial z} \end{align*}\)
Material derivative ($ rac{D()}{Dt}$) of velocity \( rac{D\vec{V}}{Dt} = rac{\partial\vec{V}}{\partial t}+(\vec{V}\cdot \vec{ abla})\vec{V}\) \( rac{Dv_j}{Dt} = rac{\partial v_j}{\partial t} +v_i rac{\partial v_j}{\partial x_i}\) \( egin{align*} rac{Du}{Dt} &= rac{\partial u}{\partial t} + u rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + v rac{\partial u}{\partial y} + w rac{\partial u}{\partial z}\ rac{Dv}{Dt} &= rac{\partial v}{\partial t} + u rac{\partial v}{\partial x} + v rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + w rac{\partial v}{\partial z}\ rac{Dw}{Dt} &= rac{\partial w}{\partial t} + u rac{\partial w}{\partial x} + v rac{\partial w}{\partial y} + w rac{\partial w}{\partial z} \end{align*}\)
Stress tensor = sum of pressure (hydrostatic) stress and viscous (deviatoric) stress \(\sigma = -P I + au\) \(\sigma_{ij}= -P\delta_{ij} + au_{ij}\) \(\sigma = - egin{bmatrix}P & 0 & 0\ 0 & P & 0\0 & 0 & P \end{bmatrix} + egin{bmatrix} au_{xx} & au_{xy} & au_{xz} \ au_{yx} & au_{yy} & au_{yz} \ au_{zx} & au_{zy} & au_{zz}\end{bmatrix}\)
Cauchy’s equation - expanded stress tensor The left-hand side of Cauchy’s equation is equal to \( ho D\vec{V}/Dt\) (derivation in Çengel and Cimbala). \( ho rac{D\vec{V}}{Dt} = - \vec{ abla} P + \vec{ abla} \cdot au + ho \vec{g}\) \( ho rac{D v_j}{Dt} = - rac{\partial P}{\partial x_j} + rac{\partial au_{ij}}{\partial x_i} + ho g_j\) \( egin{align*} ho rac{D u}{Dt}&= - rac{\partial P}{\partial x} + rac{\partial au_{xx}}{\partial x}+ rac{\partial au_{yx}}{\partial y}+ rac{\partial au_{zx}}{\partial z} + ho g_x\ ho rac{D v}{Dt}&= - rac{\partial P}{\partial y} + rac{\partial au_{xy}}{\partial x}+ rac{\partial au_{yy}}{\partial y}+ rac{\partial au_{zy}}{\partial z} + ho g_y\ ho rac{D w}{Dt}&= - rac{\partial P}{\partial z} + rac{\partial au_{xz}}{\partial x}+ rac{\partial au_{yz}}{\partial y}+ rac{\partial au_{zz}}{\partial z} + ho g_z\ \end{align*}\)
Viscous stress tensor $\zeta$ = bulk/second viscosity, usually taken to be zero \( au = \zeta (\vec{ abla}\cdot \vec{V})I + \mu [\vec{ abla}\vec{V} + (\vec{ abla}\vec{V})^ ext{T} - frac{2}{3}(\vec{ abla} \cdot \vec{V})I ]\) \( au_{ij} = \zeta rac{\partial v_k}{\partial x_k}\delta_{ij} + \mu \left[ rac{\partial v_j}{\partial x_i} + rac{\partial v_i}{\partial x_j} - rac{2}{3} rac{\partial v_k}{\partial x_k} \delta_{ij} ight]\) \( au = \zeta egin{bmatrix} \left( rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + rac{\partial w}{\partial z} ight) & 0 & 0 \ 0 & \left( rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + rac{\partial w}{\partial z} ight) & 0 \ 0 & 0 & \left( rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + rac{\partial w}{\partial z} ight) \end{bmatrix} + \mu egin{bmatrix} 2 rac{\partial u}{\partial x} - rac{2}{3}\left( rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + rac{\partial w}{\partial z} ight) & rac{\partial v}{\partial x} + rac{\partial u}{\partial y} & + rac{\partial w}{\partial x} + rac{\partial u}{\partial z} \ rac{\partial u}{\partial y} + rac{\partial v}{\partial x} & 2 rac{\partial v}{\partial y} - rac{2}{3}\left( rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + rac{\partial w}{\partial z} ight) & rac{\partial w}{\partial y} + rac{\partial v}{\partial z} \ rac{\partial u}{\partial z} + rac{\partial w}{\partial x} & rac{\partial v}{\partial z} + rac{\partial w}{\partial y} & 2 rac{\partial w}{\partial z} - rac{2}{3}\left( rac{\partial u}{\partial x} + rac{\partial v}{\partial y} + rac{\partial w}{\partial z} ight) \end{bmatrix}\)
Assumption of constant viscosity - implications \(\vec{ abla} \cdot (\vec{ abla}\vec{V}) = abla^2 \vec{V}\) and \(\vec{ abla} \cdot (\vec{ abla}\vec{V})^ ext{T} = \vec{ abla}(\vec{ abla}\cdot\vec{V})\)    
Compressible Navier-Stokes equations \( ho rac{D\vec{V}}{Dt} = - \vec{ abla} P + \mu abla^2 \vec{V} + frac{1}{3}\mu \vec{ abla}(\vec{ abla}\cdot\vec{V}) + ho \vec{g}\) \( ho rac{D v_j}{Dt} = - rac{\partial P}{\partial x_j} + \mu rac{\partial^2v_j}{\partial x_i \partial x_i} + rac{1}{3}\mu rac{\partial^2 v_i}{\partial x_j \partial x_i} + ho g_j\) \( egin{align*} ho rac{D u}{Dt} &= - rac{\partial P}{\partial x} + \mu \left( rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial z^2} ight) + rac{1}{3}\mu \left( rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial x \partial y} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial x \partial z} ight) + ho g_x\ ho rac{D v}{Dt} &= - rac{\partial P}{\partial y} + \mu \left( rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial z^2} ight) + rac{1}{3}\mu \left( rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial y\partial x} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial y \partial z} ight) + ho g_y\ ho rac{D w}{Dt} &= - rac{\partial P}{\partial z} + \mu \left( rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial z^2} ight) + rac{1}{3}\mu \left( rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial z \partial x} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial z \partial y} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial z^2} ight) + ho g_z \end{align*}\)
Incompressible Navier-Stokes equations (using \(\mu\) and \( ho\)) \( ho rac{D\vec{V}}{Dt} = - \vec{ abla} P + \mu abla^2 \vec{V} + ho \vec{g}\) \( ho rac{D v_j}{Dt} = - rac{\partial P}{\partial x_j} + \mu rac{\partial^2v_j}{\partial x_i \partial x_i} + ho g_j\) \( egin{align*} ho rac{D u}{Dt} &= - rac{\partial P}{\partial x} + \mu \left( rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial z^2} ight) + ho g_x\ ho rac{D v}{Dt} &= - rac{\partial P}{\partial y} + \mu \left( rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial z^2} ight) + ho g_y\ ho rac{D w}{Dt} &= - rac{\partial P}{\partial z} + \mu \left( rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial z^2} ight) + ho g_z \end{align*}\)
Incompressible Navier-Stokes equations (using \( u\)) \( rac{D\vec{V}}{Dt} = - rac{1}{ u}\vec{ abla} P + u abla^2 \vec{V} + \vec{g}\) \( rac{D v_j}{Dt} = - rac{1}{ u} rac{\partial P}{\partial x_j} + u rac{\partial^2v_j}{\partial x_i \partial x_i} + g_j\) \( egin{align*} rac{D u}{Dt} &= - rac{1}{ u} rac{\partial P}{\partial x} + u \left( rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 u}{\partial z^2} ight) + g_x\ rac{D v}{Dt} &= - rac{1}{ u} rac{\partial P}{\partial y} + u \left( rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 v}{\partial z^2} ight) + g_y\ rac{D w}{Dt} &= - rac{1}{ u} rac{\partial P}{\partial z} + u \left( rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial x^2} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial y^2} + rac{\partial^2 w}{\partial z^2} ight) + g_z \end{align*}\)

If you find any errors in the above, please contact me (rmcconke@uwaterloo.ca) so that I can fix them. If you found this useful, please let me know!
